title: Provides that there shall be no solicitation for credit card holders through state or city university of NY unless credit education courses are provided
summary: Provides that there shall be no solicitation for credit card holders through state or city university of NY unless credit education courses are provided.

       Introduced  by  M.  of  A.  JEFFRIES,  WRIGHT, PERRY, GLICK, DINOWITZ --
         Multi-Sponsored by -- M.  of A. CLARK, COOK, HEVESI, HOOPER,  MILLMAN,

       AN ACT to amend the banking law and the education law,  in  relation  to
         prohibiting  the  state university of New York and the city university
         of New York from permitting any persons to solicit persons  to  become
         holders of credit cards unless credit education courses are provided

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1.  The banking law is amended by adding a new article  17  to
    2  read as follows:
    3                                 ARTICLE XVII
    4             CREDIT CARD SOLICITATION; CREDIT EDUCATION COURSES
    5  SECTION 9500. PROHIBITION  OF  SOLICITING  PERSONS TO BECOME CREDIT CARD
    6                  HOLDERS AT THE STATE UNIVERSITY OF NEW YORK UNLESS CRED-
    7                  IT EDUCATION COURSES ARE PROVIDED.
    8          9501. PROHIBITION OF SOLICITING PERSONS TO  BECOME  CREDIT  CARD
    9                   HOLDERS AT THE CITY UNIVERSITY OF NEW YORK UNLESS CRED-
   10                   IT EDUCATION COURSES ARE PROVIDED.
   11    S  9500. PROHIBITION OF SOLICITING PERSONS TO BECOME CREDIT CARD HOLD-
   12  ERS AT THE STATE UNIVERSITY OF NEW YORK UNLESS CREDIT EDUCATION  COURSES
   13  ARE  PROVIDED.  THE  STATE  UNIVERSITY  OF NEW YORK SHALL NOT PERMIT ANY
   14  PERSON, INCLUDING AN ISSUER OF CREDIT CARDS, AS DEFINED  IN  SUBDIVISION
   15  THREE  OF  SECTION  FIVE  HUNDRED ELEVEN OF THE GENERAL BUSINESS LAW, TO
   16  SOLICIT PERSONS ON THE PROPERTY OF THE STATE UNIVERSITY OF NEW  YORK  TO
   17  BECOME  HOLDERS  OF  CREDIT CARDS, NOR SHALL THE STATE UNIVERSITY OF NEW
   18  YORK ENTER INTO ANY AGREEMENT ALLOWING ANY PERSON TO SOLICIT PERSONS  TO
   19  BECOME HOLDERS OF CREDIT CARDS THROUGH THE STATE UNIVERSITY OF NEW YORK,
   20  UNLESS  SUCH  PERSON  OFFERS AND PROVIDES COURSES IN CREDIT EDUCATION TO

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD01441-01-1

       A. 1361                             2

    1  STUDENTS ENROLLED IN THE STATE UNIVERSITY  OF  NEW  YORK.  SUCH  COURSES
    2  SHALL BE GIVEN IN ACCORDANCE WITH RULES AND REGULATIONS TO BE PROMULGAT-
    3  ED BY THE COMMISSIONER OF EDUCATION.
    4    S  9501. PROHIBITION OF SOLICITING PERSONS TO BECOME CREDIT CARD HOLD-
    5  ERS AT THE CITY UNIVERSITY OF NEW YORK UNLESS CREDIT  EDUCATION  COURSES
    6  ARE  PROVIDED.  THE  CITY  UNIVERSITY  OF  NEW YORK SHALL NOT PERMIT ANY
    7  PERSON, INCLUDING AN ISSUER OF CREDIT CARDS, AS DEFINED  IN  SUBDIVISION
    8  THREE  OF  SECTION  FIVE  HUNDRED ELEVEN OF THE GENERAL BUSINESS LAW, TO
    9  SOLICIT PERSONS ON THE PROPERTY OF THE CITY UNIVERSITY OF  NEW  YORK  TO
   10  BECOME  HOLDERS  OF  CREDIT  CARDS, NOR SHALL THE CITY UNIVERSITY OF NEW
   11  YORK ENTER INTO ANY AGREEMENT ALLOWING ANY PERSON TO SOLICIT PERSONS  TO
   12  BECOME  HOLDERS OF CREDIT CARDS THROUGH THE CITY UNIVERSITY OF NEW YORK,
   13  UNLESS SUCH PERSON OFFERS AND PROVIDES COURSES IN  CREDIT  EDUCATION  TO
   14  STUDENTS ENROLLED IN THE CITY UNIVERSITY OF NEW YORK. SUCH COURSES SHALL
   15  BE  GIVEN  IN ACCORDANCE WITH RULES AND REGULATIONS TO BE PROMULGATED BY
   16  THE COMMISSIONER OF EDUCATION.
   17    S 2.  The education law is amended by adding a new  section  355-d  to
   18  read as follows:
   19    S 355-D. PROHIBITION OF SOLICITING PERSONS TO BECOME CREDIT CARD HOLD-
   20  ERS  UNLESS  CREDIT EDUCATION COURSES ARE PROVIDED. THE STATE UNIVERSITY
   21  OF NEW YORK SHALL NOT PERMIT ANY PERSON, INCLUDING AN ISSUER  OF  CREDIT
   22  CARDS, AS DEFINED IN SUBDIVISION THREE OF SECTION FIVE HUNDRED ELEVEN OF
   23  THE  GENERAL  BUSINESS  LAW,  TO  SOLICIT PERSONS ON THE PROPERTY OF THE
   24  STATE UNIVERSITY OF NEW YORK TO BECOME  HOLDERS  OF  CREDIT  CARDS,  NOR
   25  SHALL THE STATE UNIVERSITY OF NEW YORK ENTER INTO ANY AGREEMENT ALLOWING
   26  ANY  PERSON TO SOLICIT PERSONS TO BECOME HOLDERS OF CREDIT CARDS THROUGH
   27  THE STATE UNIVERSITY OF NEW YORK, UNLESS SUCH PERSON OFFERS AND PROVIDES
   28  COURSES IN CREDIT EDUCATION TO STUDENTS ENROLLED IN THE STATE UNIVERSITY
   29  OF NEW YORK. SUCH COURSES SHALL BE GIVEN IN ACCORDANCE  WITH  RULES  AND
   30  REGULATIONS TO BE PROMULGATED BY THE COMMISSIONER.
   31    S  3.  The  education law is amended by adding a new section 6204-b to
   32  read as follows:
   33    S 6204-B. PROHIBITION OF SOLICITING  PERSONS  TO  BECOME  CREDIT  CARD
   34  HOLDERS UNLESS CREDIT EDUCATION COURSES ARE PROVIDED. THE CITY UNIVERSI-
   35  TY OF NEW YORK SHALL NOT PERMIT ANY PERSON, INCLUDING AN ISSUER OF CRED-
   36  IT CARDS, AS DEFINED IN SUBDIVISION THREE OF SECTION FIVE HUNDRED ELEVEN
   37  OF  THE  GENERAL BUSINESS LAW, TO SOLICIT PERSONS ON THE PROPERTY OF THE
   38  CITY UNIVERSITY OF NEW YORK TO BECOME HOLDERS OF CREDIT CARDS, NOR SHALL
   39  THE CITY UNIVERSITY OF NEW YORK ENTER INTO ANY  AGREEMENT  ALLOWING  ANY
   40  PERSON  TO SOLICIT PERSONS TO BECOME HOLDERS OF CREDIT CARDS THROUGH THE
   41  CITY UNIVERSITY OF NEW YORK, UNLESS  SUCH  PERSON  OFFERS  AND  PROVIDES
   42  COURSES  IN CREDIT EDUCATION TO STUDENTS ENROLLED IN THE CITY UNIVERSITY
   43  OF NEW YORK. SUCH COURSES SHALL BE GIVEN IN ACCORDANCE  WITH  RULES  AND
   44  REGULATIONS TO BE PROMULGATED BY THE COMMISSIONER.
   45    S  4.  This  act  shall  take  effect  on  the first of September next
   46  succeeding the date on which it shall have become a law;  provided  that
   47  the  commissioner of education is immediately authorized and directed to
   48  promulgate, amend and/or repeal any rules and regulations  necessary  to
   49  implement the provisions of this act on such effective date.
